title: What are the pros and cons of Gandhi Medical College, Secunderabad? - Quora
tags: Bachelor of Medicine and Bachelor of Surgery Degrees

response.answer_text: I did not study there but can sure list few pros and cons Pros: Being the topmost medical college in the city every other person wants to join thereIts a government college so I think the fees you pay will be lowerYou would get the best experience as you would see all kinds of diseases as it is one of the two government hospitals,the other being the fever hospital kachiguda.They would have the most experienced doctors and seniors and strong alumini baseIt is in the heart of the city so you wouldn't face much difficulty in transportingCons: You might be asked to replace nurses during huge break of certain disease like during the H1N1 epidemic or the dengue epidemic.You might face ragging or interaction as it is calledYou must take good care of yourself admist all that sick crowdYou could have better life if you are a telguite.I think only these would make a difference Good luck!

The pros : The most important one is that the hospital and the college are in the same campus. So there is no wastage of time shuttling between the hospital and college.The medical PG coaching centers are at approachable distances from the college. They are mostly at RTC X roads or in Musheerabad.The cons : When compared to Osmania, the patient inflow is little less as Osmania has separate hospitals for most of the departments but there is no dearth of patients in any of the departments of Gandhi and we also get to see lots of types of cases.On the whole Gandhi is most preferred for the 1st reason. This is all what i think. I’ ll surely update the answer once i get more reasons.
